snippet: Positive economic news is no guarantee of electoral success, partly because many middle-income Americans have not reaped the fruits of the recovery.
abstract: News analysis; Democrats are likely to capitalize on April's sharp and unexpected drop in nation's unemployment rate to try and retain control of Senate and hold off Republican gains in the House come fall's mid-term elections; positive economic news, however, has yet to yield palpable benefits to nation's middle class.
lead_paragraph: Positive economic news is no guarantee of electoral success, partly because many middle-income Americans have not reaped the fruits of the recovery.

headline.main: Democrats Struggle to Turn Economic Gains Into Political Ones
headline.print_headline: Democrats Struggle to Turn Economic Gains Into Political Ones
